column4: Hey guys, after 2 years of owning my laptop, I just realized that the wifi adapter onboard is supported in Linux as well as Aircrack-ng. My laptop currently runs a 64 bit OS (has 4 gb ram) should I go with 32 bit Ubuntu, or 64 bit, or does it really not matter?
if you intend to use custom drivers for aircrack 32bit may be your only option
thanks for the advice, from my reading online the native drivers should work.
i would try both, aircrack can be picky
